question.body: Most of the vessels in the body are paired. Which of the following is not a paired vein?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The suprarenal glands, also called the adrenal glands, are paired, with one vein returning blood from each.
Incorrect. The gonadal veins, called the ovarian veins and females, or the testicular veins in males, are paired.
Incorrect. Although there is only one liver, it is a large organ and has paired veins returning blood from it to the vena cava.
Correct. The spleen is a single, relatively small organ in the abdomen, with a single vein returning blood from it.

part.hint: Paired veins commonly occur with paired, or large, structures.
